A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Very clearly better than the prequels\, but very clearly lagging behind Force Awakens and the original trilogy\, this Star Wars film is in a tier of its own in terms of quality. It delivers strongly on much of whats made the franchise popular\, but is not without its issues. As a popcorn flick\, there are quality action scenes\, yes\, but were forced to wait a long time for them. But while Force Awakens did a spectacular job of keeping us invested in the stories of Rey and Finn by giving them clear\, personal stakes\, Last Jedi suffers from centering on a plot that feels too big for audiences to relate to. Everything is tied to The Resistance\, a group of 200 people we really have no reason to care about. Yes\, Rey and Finn are part of the Resistance but were never really given reasons for why it matters to them. As a result the fate of the Resistance hardly even feels connected to the fate of our heroes. All in all\, though\, its still got a handful of entertaining moments that ultimately redeem it and make it worth your while. Worth going to see\, but dont set the bar too high for this one.
